stories.title: Maximizing the Present and the Future

stories.text:
Tomorrow & Friday a bunch of my coworkers are doing a hackathon. I'm considering launching a simple site to follow along with their progress, and possibly a super basic livestream.

I'm just trying to gauge interest. Would anyone want to follow along or is it a waste of effort?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any Interest in Following a Hackathon?
Track Your Favorite Crypto Prices in Slack with This Node.js Bot
UFOs left radiation burns and unaccounted for pregnancies new Pentagon report

stories.text:
Hey HN,

A week ago, we launched EnvKey's v2 with a Show HN: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30855879

It was the top Show HN of the day, and we got a lot of great feedback. One of the most common pieces of feedback we received was that the pricing was way too complicated.

Based on this feedback, we decided to simplify it quite a lot, as well as add a new tier.

Here's the new pricing: https://v2.envkey.com/pricing

And here's a summary of the changes: https://mailchi.mp/eec5d70dc70b/envkey-v2-is-live-20224903

If you saw our Show HN and thought EnvKey was interesting, but were confused or turned off by the pricing page, I'd love to hear your thoughts! Questions or feedback on any other aspect of EnvKey are also welcome.
stories.title: Tell HN: We simplified EnvKey's v2 pricing
How left brain asymmetry is related to reading ability
Archaeologists excavate giant stone spheres in Costa Rica

stories.text:
I know they're simply following Airbnb's model of showing only the daily price, then tacking on extra fees at checkout, but it's hostile to the customer.

When the minimum final cost is 50% more than the list price, I suppose deception is the best way to drive signups.

Ironically, I may have been more likely to complete my purchase had I seen true numbers from the start. The initial fee had me thinking it was remarkably affordable.
stories.title: Turo Requires a Driver's License Number and Credit Card to Show Full Price
